title: Structure and Function of the Chloroplast

content.question: (a) Describe the major process that takes place in this eukaryotic organelle.

frqParts.text: (a) Describe the major process that takes place in this eukaryotic organelle.
(b) Explain the function of the structure labeled with an <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in Figure 1.

(c) On the template in the space provided for your response, represent the location where carbon fixation takes place by writing "<math alttext="C F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>" and the location of the electron transport proteins by writing "<math alttext="E T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ETP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>".
(d) Explain how the shape and stacking of the thylakoids contributes to the rate of carbon fixation by the chloroplast.
